conclusion: To determine the temperature of state D, analyze the processes in the ABCDA cycle.
Process A to B is an isochoric process with pressure increasing from P1 to P2 at volume V1.
Using the ideal gas law, find temperature at state B: T_B = T_0 * (P_2 / P_1).
Process B to C is an isobaric process with volume increasing from V1 to V2 at constant pressure P2.
Find temperature at state C: T_C = T_B * (V_2 / V_1) = T_0 * (P_2 / P_1) * (V_2 / V_1).
Process C to D is an isochoric process with pressure decreasing from P2 to P1 at volume V2.
Find temperature at state D: T_D = T_C * (P_1 / P_2) = T_0 * (V_2 / V_1).
The temperature at state D is T_D = T_0 * (V_2 / V_1).
